Revised to the folder level by Dee Bowers
Brooklyn Historical Society
Daughters of the American Revolution, Battle Pass Chapter records
Daughters of the American Revolution. Battle Pass Chapter (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
1977.294
0.2 Linear Feet in nine folders
1858-1961 The Daughters of the American Revolution, Battle Pass Chapter records include documents, publications, ephemera, and artifacts documenting the chapter and its activities from circa 1900 to the 1950s. It also includes money and bonds dated 1858-1872. A0060
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Elaine Herne, 1966.
Arrangement
The collection is arranged into folders by type.
Historical note
The Daughters of the American Revolution, Battle Pass Chapter was organized in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1905.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Daughters of the American Revolution, Battle Pass chapter records, 1977.294, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Processing Information
This collection was originally minimally processed to the collection level. In May 2023 it was reprocessed to the file level by Dee Bowers. As part of that reprocessing some of the materials were rehoused and the newsclippings were photocopied and the originals discarded.
Related Materials
Brooklyn clubs collection (ARC.172)
Brooklyn photograph and illustration collection (ARC.202), subject: Clubs and Associations
United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection (1974.120)
Barrington, Lewis. Historic restorations of the Daughters of the American revolution. NA707 .B26 1941
Darling, Flora Adams. Founding and organization of the Daughters of the American Revolution and Daughters of the Revolution. E202.5 D37 1901
Women of '76 Chapter, National Society, Daughters of the American Revolution, Brooklyn, New York, organized 1900, National number 524. E202.D2 B7 1940
Scope and Contents
The Daughters of the American Revolution, Battle Pass Chapter records span the period 1858 to 1961 and measure 0.2 linear feet. Included in the records are the chapter's by-laws, dated 1913 to 1954; correspondence, reports, and programs, dated 1922 to 1961; address books, photographs, postcards, and brochures of historical sites; the Book of American Creed, dated 1921; and various units of United States currency, dated 1858 to 1872.
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
